article_text: The rejection of federal funds for Medicaid expansion by leaders in Tallahassee was never a smart decision. Now it looks even worse as the feds prepare to shut down a healthcare pipeline that pours about $1.3 billion into a statewide program that aids hospitals that care for Florida’s neediest.

article_metadata.title: Another Florida healthcare crisis | Miami Herald

article_summary:
The rejection of federal funds for Medicaid expansion by leaders in Tallahassee was never a smart decision.
Now it looks even worse as the feds prepare to shut down a healthcare pipeline that pours about $1.3 billion into a statewide program that aids hospitals that care for Florida’s neediest.
